member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.Composite.Wpf.Regions.RegionManager
member.summary: This class is responsible for maintaining a collection of regions and attaching regions to controls.
member.remarks: This class supplies the attached properties that can be used for simple region creation from XAML. It finds an adapter mapped to a WPF control and associates a new region to that control by calling automatically.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.Composite.Wpf.Regions.RegionManager.RegionNameProperty
member.summary: Identifies the RegionName attached property.
member.remarks: When a control has both the and attached properties set to a value different than and there is a mapping registered for the control, it will create and adapt a new region for that control, and register it in the with the specified region name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.Composite.Wpf.Properties.Resources.AdapterInvalidTypeException

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.Composite.Wpf.Properties.Resources.ContentControlHasContentException
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to ContentControl's Content property is not empty. This control is being associated with a region, but the control is already bound to something else. If you did not explicitly set the control's Content property, this exception may be caused by a change in the value of the inherited RegionManager attached property..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.Composite.Wpf.Properties.Resources.DeactiveNotPossibleException
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Deactivation is not possible in this type of region..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.Composite.Wpf.Properties.Resources.ItemsControlHasItemsSourceException
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to ItemsControl's ItemsSource property is not empty. If you did not explicitly set the control's ItemSource property, this exception may be caused by a change in the value of the inherited RegionManager attached property..

member.summary: Subscribes a delegate to an event that will be published on the .
member.param: The delegate that gets executed when the event is published.
When , the keeps a reference to the subscriber so it does not get garbage collected.
member.returns: A that uniquely identifies the added subscription.

If is set to , will maintain a to the Target of the supplied delegate. If not using a WeakReference ( is ), the user must explicitly call Unsubscribe for the event when disposing the subscriber in order to avoid memory leaks or unexepcted behavior.
The CompositeWpfEvent collection is thread-safe.
